title: Monopolist shown on graph will exit in long run

content.question: Which of the following will the firm do in the long run if market conditions do not change?

choices.label: It will increase output to <math alttext="Q sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and lower price to <math alttext="P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> to minimize losses.

It will increase output to <math alttext="Q sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and raise price to <math alttext="P sub 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> to earn zero economic profit.

It will produce <math alttext="Q sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and set price equal to marginal revenue.
It will build a larger plant to achieve decreasing returns to scale.
